name: unslaked
content:
unslaked adjective
(FEELING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal If someone's feeling of wanting something is unslaked, they have not stopped wanting it: The public thirst for information will continue unslaked. His appetite for gossip is completely unslaked. Related word
slake
More examplesFewer examplesHer passion for power remains unslaked. Politicians, driven by the unslaked blood-thirst of the public, were spineless in this regard.

unslaked adjective
(CHEMICAL)
Unslaked lime (= a white chemical substance) has not been treated with water to produce a different chemical (calcium hydroxide): Unslaked lime (CaO) was produced by heating limestone at high temperatures. Unslaked fragments of shell are saved for the next batch.
